title: Facebook removes 'coordinated' fake accounts in UAE, Egypt, Nigeria and Indonesia
text: Facebook says it has removed multiple accounts involved in what it terms "coordinated inauthentic behavior" on both its Facebook and Instagram platforms.

title: U.S. House panel wants Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify on Libra by January
text: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg has tentatively agreed to testify before a U.S. House committee on Oct.

title: Key Words: Mark Zuckerberg on billionaires: ‘At some level, no one deserves to have that much money’
text: At least one billionaire thinks Sen. Bernie Sanders may have a point when he says that billionaires shouldn’t exist.

title: Zuckerberg says Facebook will sue to stop EU’s global content takedowns
text: Facebook plans to challenge Europe’s top court, which today ruled that EU countries can order Facebook to globally remove content that violates local laws. Facebook currently complies with proper legal requests to remove content that breaks a nation’s laws, but can leave it up for global viewers if the post doesn’t violate its Community Standards.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg live streams employee Q&A in rare move
text: Zuckerberg's internal Q&As with employees were leaked earlier this week.

title: US, UK and Australia urge Facebook to create backdoor access to encrypted messages
text: Facebook says it opposes calls for backdoors that would ‘undermine the privacy and security of people everywhere’

title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg live-streams employee Q&A, 'stands by' comments in leaked recording
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday publicly live streamed a Q&A session with his employees after recordings from a similar meeting in July were leaked and published earlier this week.

title: AG Barr calls on Facebook to limit message-encryption plans
text: FOX Business’ Jackie DeAngelis reports on Attorney General William Barr pressing Facebook with regards to privacy.

title: Tale of two F.A.A.N.G. stocks: 5 trades
text: The "Fast Money" traders give you 5 trades in some FAANG names as two of them deal with some unpleasant news today.

title: Facebook is being leant on by US, UK, Australia to ditch its end-to-end encryption expansion plan
text: Here we go again. Western governments are once again dialling up their attack on end-to-end encryption — calling for either no e2e encryption or backdoored e2e encryption so platforms can be commanded to serve state agents with messaging data in “a readable and usable format”.

title: US, UK and Australia urge Facebook to halt plan to encrypt all user messages
text: US Attorney General William Barr and senior government officials from the UK and Australia are formally asking Facebook give up on its plan to encrypt user messages across its platforms.

title: Market Break Creates Tech Stock Buying Opportunity
text: The recent dip in the stock market has created a buying opportunity for your favorite tech stocks that you thought you missed out on. The equity market breakdown was caused by anxious investors concerned about an economic slowdown.

title: Barr Pushes Facebook for Access to WhatsApp Messages
text: The Justice Department has long sought access to encrypted messages, alarming privacy advocates.

title: Governments call on Facebook to pause encryption efforts
text: In a letter to Mark Zuckerberg, US, UK and Australian officials worry Facebook’s encryption efforts will help child predators.

title: AG Barr asks Facebook to hold off encryption plans for messaging services: report
text: U.S. Attorney General William Barr wants Facebook Inc. FB, +2.46% to delay plans to include encryption on its messaging services until it determines a way to provide government access for investigative purposes.

title: AG Barr to call on Facebook to limit encryption plans: Reports
text: Attorney General William Barr will ask Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to hold off on his plans to encrypt the company's three messaging services until officials can determine it will not reduce public safety, BuzzFeed News reported Thursday.

title: Facebook Can Be Forced to Delete Content Worldwide, E.U.’s Top Court Rules
text: The decision that individual countries can order Facebook to take down posts globally sets a benchmark for the reach of European laws governing the internet.

title: Attorney General Barr will reportedly ask Facebook to postpone its encrypted messaging plans
text: AG William Barr asked Facebook to postpone encryption plans in a draft of an open letter obtained by BuzzFeed News.

title: Facebook's Instagram unveils 'Threads' messaging app for 'close friends'
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +2.43% has introduced Thursday "Threads" from Instagram, a standalone camera-first messaging app that allows users to stay more connected with a close circle of friends through photos and videos.

title: Snap shares plunge after Facebook's latest clone attempt
text: Snap shares fell as much as 7% on Thursday after Facebook announced the launch of Threads, a new messaging app for Instagram users.

title: Facebook's Instagram launches Snapchat-like 'Threads' app
text: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it was launching a separate camera-first messaging app, "Threads", for it's photo-sharing platform Instagram, another blow in the company's social media war with smaller rival Snapchat.

title: Instagram takes another page from Snapchat's playbook with new Threads app
text: The future of Instagram continues to look more and more like Snapchat. The latest example: a new camera-focused app for messaging close friends -- which reads like a product description for rival Snapchat.

title: 3 FANG Stocks to Buy Into Earnings
text: Wall Street is reeling from headlines. But this is the time to construct a shopping list including the FANG stocks to buy into earnings.

title: Instagram launches Threads, a Close Friends chat app with auto-status
text: What if Instagram could automatically tell you’re Close Friends you’re 🏠 (home), 🤓 (working), 🚗 (on the move), or 🛋️ (chilling and might want to hang out)?

title: Facebook launches Instagram Threads, its latest attempt to clone Snapchat
text: Facebook announces the launch of Threads, a new messaging app for Instagram users.

title: Zuckerberg warned new privacy rules could help abusers
text: Mark Zuckerberg has been warned that Facebook's new privacy proposals could help child abusers evade detection, with an estimated 12 million suspected incidents going unflagged.

title: Governments won’t be able to stop Facebook and Google from abusive tracking on smartphones — but Apple could
text: Another day, another headline saying Alphabet’s Google and Facebook are being investigated for allegedly breaking privacy laws and engaging in anti-trust behavior.

title: Facebook can be forced to remove illegal content worldwide: EU court
text: Facebook can be ordered to police and remove illegal content worldwide, Europe’s top court said on Thursday, in a landmark ruling that rights advocates say could allow authoritarian regimes to silence critics. The ruling came just a week after the same court told Google that it does not have to apply Europe’s “right to be.

title: EU can order Facebook to remove illegal content worldwide, court rules
text: Facebook may need to take down content that's illegal in EU countries even if it's posted by users from elsewhere.

title: A court ordered Facebook to take down a post. The decision could affect social media around the world
text: The top European court has ruled Facebook and other internet companies can be forced to remove certain content worldwide.

title: Facebook faces tougher controls after EU ruling
text: European court of justice says Facebook can be ordered to remove defamatory material

title: Libra has regulators worried about 'privatization of monetary policy': Analyst
text: Ian Harnett, co-founder and chief investment strategist of Absolute Strategy Research, says central banks are racing to introduce digital currency before Facebook does.

title: Facebook May Need to Censor Hateful Posts Globally in EU Ruling
text: Oct.03 -- Facebook Inc.

title: E.U.’s Top Court Rules Against Facebook in Global Takedown Case
text: Comments posted on the social network about an Austrian politician became a battle over the reach of European defamation laws on the internet.

title: Turkey fines Facebook $282,000 over privacy breach
text: Turkish authorities have fined Facebook Inc  1.6 million lira ($282,000) for violation of data protection laws which affected nearly 300,000 people, the Personal Data Protection Board (KVKK) said on Thursday.
